tweet: I believe that the time has come for the Judiciary Committee to open a formal impeachment inquiry and collect the evidence necessary to build a strong case against President Trump: http://defazio.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/statement-from-rep-peter-defazio-on-opening-an-impeachment-inquiry …

The planet has just experienced its hottest June ever, according to @NOAA. Climate scientists agree: this is the result of climate change. We must take action to combat the impacts of greenhouse gases on our planet before it's too late: https://apnews.com/020bea71918d466aa186a4eca4321d61 …

The House has finally passed a much-needed reform to the Affordable Care Act: a repeal of the #CadillacTax. I was opposed to its inclusion in the ACA and have supported its repeal ever since. This 40% tax on employer-sponsored plans puts an unfair burden on middle class families.

After the longest period in history w/out an increase, the House voted today to raise the federal minimum wage. This would lift millions out of poverty, give 30 million Americans a raise, and bring the nat’l wage on par with Oregon's, creating a level playing field. #RaiseTheWage

If the Trump Administration has its way, the few gray wolves in the United States may soon become extinct. They are a vital part to a balanced ecosystem and I will continue to fight against this short-sighted policy. https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/we-must-protect-the-wolves/2019/07/12/9be223c0-a4e5-11e9-b732-41a79c2551bf_story.html?utm_term=.88e12be50ef2 …

I've criticized our relationship with Saudi Arabia for decades, but Trump has taken this relationship to a new extreme & cozied up to a ruler who was involved in the murder of US resident Jamal Khashoggi. We must hold the Saudis accountable. pic.twitter.com/2QXELue6Yf

The President’s racist and xenophobic language has no place anywhere, let alone in the Twitter feed of the Commander-in-Chief. The President should apologize and I look forward to supporting a resolution in the House condemning his actions.

I cosponsored an amendment, which passed today, to prevent the Trump administration and warhawk John Bolton from starting a war with Iran unless authorized by Congress. Congress must exercise its constitutional duty and prevent yet another endless war in the Middle East.

As thousands take part in Lights for Liberty vigils across Oregon, the U.S., and the globe, I stand in strong opposition to the Trump administration’s inhumane detention policies: https://defazio.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/statement-from-rep-peter-defazio-on-lights-for-liberty-rallies …

Now more than ever, Congress needs to reassert its constitutional authority and act as a check on Trump's war-making powers. As I did under Obama, I'm proud to support legislation that reduces the Pentagon's slush fund for endless wars overseas without congressional approval. pic.twitter.com/rgZ94CE66b

I’m proud to lead with my Oregon colleague @EarlBlumenauer, @BernieSanders, and @AOC by being an original cosponsor of the #ClimateEmergencyResolution. Climate change is an existential threat and we must take action before it’s too late.
Wishing everyone a safe and happy Fourth. Happy Independence Day! pic.twitter.com/9HOaTcEhzR

The DOJ's Inspector General is opening an investigation into the Trump Administration's involvement in plans for relocating the FBI Building. We must be sure that the President is not trying to personally profit off of the sale of government buildings: https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/justice-department-watchdog-to-investigate-decision-to-cancel-fbi-headquarters-plan/2019/07/03/76971d76-9d85-11e9-9ed4-c9089972ad5a_story.html?utm_term=.89893f49b32c …
